attributes.action: Remove the requirement of mandatory religious acts in public schools.
attributes.background: The Independent quotes (06/12/15) "under exiting laws, school have a statuary duty to ensure pupils take part "each school day in acts of worship."
attributes.additional_details:
The article states "While faith schools are permitted to hold acts of worship in accordance with their religious character, in secular schools the worship must be wholly & mainly of a Christian character." 

https://www.independent.co.uk/news/education/education-news/mandatory-christian-prayers-in-schools-should-be-axed-academics-say-a6762256.html viewed: 13th of October 2018.

In Wales and England pupils are able to opt out, but they still sit and watch.

attributes.action: Make all new school buses zero-emission vehicles from 2020.
attributes.background: Over a million children in the UK use school transport provided by transit buses, contracted coaches, minibuses and taxis each day. We’re asking the government to ensure the vehicles carrying our children to school don’t add to the already harmful levels of air pollution.
attributes.additional_details:
Air quality in the UK has been described as a public health emergency contributing to 40,000 premature deaths per year and it's small children who are affected the most. Electric school bus motors
produce zero emissions. This means cleaner, healthier air while
kids wait to board the bus & inside the cabin.

attributes.action: Introduce a law to fit microchips in every ammunition round produced in the UK
attributes.background: With gun crime on the rise in the UK, it makes sense to try to detect those people carrying ammunition by means of a detection device worn by anyone with a reason to do so e.g. Police officers. A gun with no ammunition cannot kill.
attributes.additional_details: This will take time, but will reap benefits in years to come once existing stocks have depleted. This would need a small hand held device that could be worn by security officials that will send a vibrating alarm to the wearer and log the GPS location and serial numbers of all ammunition read by the microchips. The microchips would be similar to those used in dogs, only the size of a grain of rice. They would be inserted, by law into the gunpowder of every round made.

attributes.action: Allow Tattoos for 16 year olds with parental consent
attributes.background: Allow special tattoos for 16 year olds in meanings of birth, death and engagements e.g. 16.04.10 and scan photo or 16.04.10 to 28.02.64 and picture portrait.
attributes.additional_details: Allow memorable tattoos for 16 year olds.

attributes.action: One Island-One Member of Parliament -please keep our single MP for Isle of Wight
attributes.background:
10 September 2018
Commission's "final recommendations" to divide the Island to have 2 MPs. This is divisive. We need one MP to speak for all of us. One Island - one MP!

http://www.iwcp.co.uk/news/16832323.final-recommendations-for-isle-of-wight-parliamentary-constituencies-revealed/?ref=mr&lp=4
attributes.additional_details:
If you want one MP to support all of us as a united Island with one strong voice in Parliament, please support this petition. 

Thank you very much for your kind help.

attributes.action: Ask the Indian government to take action against the persecution of Christians
attributes.background: India is an ally of the UK and also the world's largest democracy. The UK should ask the Indian government to allow more religious freedom and take action against the rising persecution of Christians at the hands of Hindu radical groups.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.theguardian.com/world/2008/oct/19/orissa-violence-india-christianity-hinduism 

https://www.opendoorsusa.org/christian-persecution/world-watch-list/india/

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Religious_violence_in_Odisha 

https://www.christiantoday.com/article/hindu-extremists-threaten-to-kill-christians-in-india-if-they-utter-the-name-of-christ/63567.htm 

http://www.foxnews.com/world/2016/03/14/christian-persecution-by-hindus-rises-in-india-say-humanitarian-groups.html

attributes.action: Make it optional to leave education at the age of 16.
attributes.background: Many young people are carers or need to support their family and they shouldn't be forced into staying in education as this restricts them from getting the income that they need. Britain's youth should not be held back because of the education system.
attributes.additional_details: You can have children and get married at the age of 16 but you can not leave education to get a job or to follow the career path that you want. The education system holds the youth back from getting what they truly want in life, education is not for everyone and therefore you should not be forced to carry on with it if you believe you are ready to leave. By the age of 16 you have enough knowledge to understand and know what you want for the future and for you.

attributes.action: Require social media sites to have warnings of flashing imagery/strobe lighting.
attributes.background: So often nowadays, people are going to parties and concerts and posting about it on social media which inevitably means that some content contains flashing imagery, however people with epilepsy and/or sensory issues are just opening up stories without a warning, which could bring on unease to them.
attributes.additional_details: If people are warned that a post contains flashing imagery, then it can make things so much easier for people with sensory issues and they then don't have to process all the flashing lights which can be overwhelming for many and so overall, including warnings on social media posts would definitely make sites such as Snapchat and instagram more accessible and friendly for many people, whether they suffer from epilepsy, sensory issues or simply find that flashing imagery can bring on anxiety.

attributes.action: Lower the speed limit on the A419, also put cameras on the road
attributes.background: I was involved in a serious car accident on the A419 that wasnt my fault. This was due to the speed in which the car behind me was driving, and did not have time to react. On this night 3 accidents, including mine happened. Accidents happen on this road daily and i think something needs to happen.
attributes.additional_details: You can see evidence on the Wiltshire Police accident. They are called out to accidents daily on the A419 I am sure they are tired of this.

attributes.action: Stop car insurers hiking premiums for 'non-fault'  or 'notification only' cases
attributes.background: I recently received my renewal invitation. They had hiked my premiums by nearly 3x. They told me that it was because I had notified them March last year that someone had smashed my windscreen. I did not make a claim. They had classed the notification as an 'at fault claim'. This needs to stop.
attributes.additional_details:
"Admiral is one insurer that bumps up premiums after just one non-fault accident. It claims it is justified in doing so because those involved in one are more likely to be involved in another accident later on. 

"By having a non-fault claim our customers fall into a category that we see as a higher risk to insure."

‘We rate on the fact an incident has occurred, whether they have claimed or not.’

Original article:
https://www.thisismoney.co.uk/money/cars/article-3052191/How-drivers-insurance-costs-soar-no-fault-accidents-don-t-claim.html

It has to stop. The industry needs tighter regulations against this kind of profiteering, as that's what I, and a LOT of drivers see it as

attributes.action: Clarify the criteria for Secure Accommodation that is used by Local Authorities.
attributes.background: Secure accommodation should be used as a last resort and the Government should make this clear to Local Authorities in its guidance.

attributes.action: Open a public inquiry into the deaths at Gosport Memorial Hospital
attributes.background: The Gosport Independent Panel found over 450 lives were shortened due to the pattern of prescribing and administering of opioids. This deserves a public inquiry.
attributes.additional_details: BBC Panorama also investigated this.

attributes.action: Extend article 50 and call for a 'Citizen's Assembly' to resolve Brexit crisis
attributes.background: The Brexit debate has caused a deep societal divide in Britain which cannot be resolved by either pushing a 'no deal', 'no Brexit' or Teresa May's failed deal. A Citizen's Assembly, rather than a divisive second referendum, can heal this divide, but this needs time.
attributes.additional_details:
The time has come that the decision is given back to the people, not by a divisive second referendum but a healing, and unifying Citizen's Assembly.
A Citizen's Assembly worked very well in Ireland to heal the divide over abortion.

attributes.action: Change the Help to Buy rule of owning a property or share of one abroad.
attributes.background: My wife & I are British Citizens. Originally from abroad, we have family who still there. We are trying to buy a house through one the Government's Help-To-Buy Schemes but don't qualify because unfortunately my mother died and left me a share of her property in her will.
attributes.additional_details: The law of the country says I cannot give my share away to any of the heirs and trying to sell it to a third party individual is near impossible given the risks and future shared ownership with private individuals of the property. This continues to disqualify my family & I from the Help-To-Buy Schemes.

attributes.action: Make it a legal UK requirement that councils provide public toilets.
attributes.background: Throughout the UK, public toilets are closing. These actions are unfair on all sections of our society. It is a natural requirement to use toilets. It is illegal to defecate or urinate in the street so it should be a legal requirement to provide the facilities required to avoide breaking the law.
attributes.additional_details:
When the body needs to meet such needs, no amount of will power will over ride this no mater what the legal penalty is so what civilised country should put its citizens in such a position.

Councils should legally provide such services in all urban areas but should also not issue licences to any businesses selling refreshments if there are not toilet facilities available to its customers within say 100 meters of the business.

attributes.action: UK government to urge the Japanese government to stop the mutilation of dolphins
attributes.background: The Japanese fishermen cut the fins of dolphins that they catch in their nets and then release them back into the sea to die a slow and agonising death

attributes.action: Hold a Referendum on whether to give or not give foreign aid.
attributes.background: If 80% of voters in this referendum are in favour of NOT giving foreign aid, then foreign aid should be reduced by 80%, with similar action for any result.
attributes.additional_details: A great number of people are sickened and disgusted at a) The amount given away in Foreign Aid, and b) when that aid is given to unsuitable recipients. Foreign Aid should therefore be dependant on voters allowing it to be made by voting for it.

attributes.action: Make dog ownership/dog microchip details operate like car ownership.
attributes.background: Many people will have seen the cctv footage of a dog being abandoned on the side of a road in Trentham on 17/12/2018. The dog apparently had two previous owners but microchip details were not available of the current owner.
attributes.additional_details: It is a legal requirement in the UK that dogs of 8 weeks or over are microchipped and the details are updated but this clearly is not working with many dogs being identified with no updated microchip information. The government should make dog ownership similar to car ownership and V5C documentation. Therefore if you sold or transferred ownership to someone else it is the current owners responsibility to check and collect proof of name and address and send details to the microchip company.

attributes.action: All car parks should have at least 10% electric car charging stations (free).
attributes.background: All car parks with more than 10 bays should have mandatory car charging stations available. All office building and warehouses with permanent employee presence where the car is parked for more than 8 hours should have free car charging facilities.
attributes.additional_details:
People go in super markets and normally spend 20 to 60 minutes, car manufacturers say that the car be charged from 20% to 80% in 40 minutes, these 40 minutes should be utilised and people will have the cars charged up when they are done shopping, and this charging should be free.
The 10% minimum requirement mentioned above should be raised by 5% each year.
At permanent place of work this energy for car charging should mainly come from Solar panels.

attributes.action: Make all foreign lorry/hgv drivers carry insurance cards
attributes.background: To enter the uk, all lorry hgv drivers must carry a insurance card for the hgv they are driving, or a valid card from their employers, incase of a accident or incident, the card would have employment address and insurance details on, drive without one should fine the driver and take the hgv away
attributes.additional_details:
I was involved in a accident and it took the police 45 mins to get his details and his insurance how would the public who are shaken up get that information 
Even the police said good luck 
So a card with insurance address, policy number, name of the employer

attributes.action: Amend Royal Charter to stop BBC paying more than twice Prime Minister’s salary
attributes.background: The BBC is a public service and should not pay excessive salaries or other payments to individuals. Paying anyone over £1.5m a year to watch and comment on sport or present a 3 hour radio show is too much. Alternative talent could be found at lower salary levels.
attributes.additional_details: Publicly funded bodies have shown disregard for financial discipline and the BBC may be the worst. If commercial entities want to pay their staff excessive salaries and perks let their shareholders approve it or otherwise. The taxpayers are the BBC shareholders and I say enough is enough. who work primarily for the BBC should also pay tax and NI like everyone else at source. The talent will evolve to fill any gaps.

attributes.action: Sanitary products must become free of charge to all young women 18 or under.
attributes.background: Girls and young women are struggling to buy sanitary products for themselves which leaves them a unpleasant experience during their period. There are many young women living in poverty who can't provide for themselves so receiving free sanitary products would be beneficial.

attributes.action: Water safety & effects of cold water to be taught to teenagers
attributes.background: In 2018 we have seen a increase in the amount of deaths in water from cold water shock and drowning, This increase is due to the hot weather we have had. This makes it more worrying that none really trains members of the community or school children on the dangers of open water and how to stay safe.
attributes.additional_details:
We really need to train youngsters and adults in the dangers of cold water shock, this can be triggered by jumping into the water which holds its temperature between 10 degrees - 15 degrees, 

The biggest danger is inhaling water and drowning, even if the water is flat, calm and you know how to swim. Cold Water Shock causes an immediate loss of breathing control. You take one or more huge gasps, followed by hyperventilation – very rapid breathing that is hard or impossible for you to control.

attributes.action: Review the use of Palm Oil in products consumed in the UK and it’s taxation.
attributes.background: Palm oil is widely used in everyday products, I believe more can be done to protect areas destroyed for palm oil plantations. I am requesting to UK to set the trend of reviewing the use and availability of palm oil including its taxation.

attributes.action: Minimum speed limit for motorways.
attributes.background: Make the minimum speed limit for cars on motorways to match the maximum speed for trucks. Cars travelling slower than trucks cause dangerous situations where the truck has to overtake or be forced to slow down. This is especially dangerous on two lane sections and in bad weather.

attributes.action: Protect British food and drink in future trade deals
attributes.background: I would like the Government to act now and introduce legislation that ensures protected designation of origin (PDO), protected geographical indication (PGI), and traditional specialities guaranteed (TSG), remain a part of the British food and drink industry post Brexit.
attributes.additional_details: I urge you to back British business and sign our petition that will help promote our vital food and drink industries.

attributes.action: Require school housing facilities (boarding houses) to provide recycling bins
attributes.background: Young minds should be taught the importance of protecting the planet so it is there for future generations.In the countryside the evidence of humans encroaching on the environment is very clear. Schools have the ability to change the minds of the future and should use this ability for our benefit.
attributes.additional_details: School’s with an average of 650 pupils plus staff produces a lot of waste annually. That waste should be disposed of correctly and safely.Up to 60% of the rubbish that ends up in the bin could be recycled and isn’t. Also, there is 260 million tons of plastic produced each year (globally), about 10 percent ends up in our oceans. This plastic can take between 450-1000 years to decompose.

attributes.action: All staff in semh schools to be MHFA trained and a minimum of 7 inset days.
attributes.background: SEMH schools have students with varying needs that are written into an EHCP. It's only right that adequate mandatory training is available to all staff to help these students especially with the varying mental health needs. Funding and timing is a major factor, therefore more inset days are needed.
attributes.additional_details: 1 in 4 of us are diagnosed with a MH illness at some point. 50% off these diagnosed needs are displayed at the age of 14. Semh schools deal with a lot of these students that display these needs alongside other needs. To help these students and to give them the best they deserve, it should be mandatory that EVERY member of staff is MHFA trained to recognise and deal with students that are in crisis. These members of staff are the early help for most of these students.

attributes.action: Reclassify the antihistamine fexofenadine hydrochloride from POM to P.
attributes.background: There should be greater availability of more powerful antihistamines which can help to reverse the allergic reaction process in the very early stages. Fexofenadine hydrochloride is available at pharmacies in many European countries, UAE, Japan and Australia.
attributes.additional_details:
According to Medicines and Healthcare Products Regulatory Agency (May, 2016) as part of a freedom of information request, the drug remains as classified as a prescription only medicine (POM) in the UK.
Many deaths could be prevented as a result of reclassification to P, where the drug can be made more accessible by being issued under the supervision of a pharmacist.

attributes.action: Ban perpetrators of domestic violence representing themselves in family court
attributes.background: In domestic abuse cases in family court, the abuser continues to abuse and control their victim by choosing to self-represent. This is a way for them to obtain personal information i.e. medical records about their victim.
attributes.additional_details: Women’s aid are aware of the perpetrators motives and are in agreement the way family courts are run needs to change. Women are losing their children due to domestic abuse even when they leave the abuser the abuse still continues. The abuser uses the family court to obtain personal information on their victim by self-representing. This needs to be stopped. The criminal courts have put this in place so why not the civil courts? Women are being put through massive amount of stress during these proceedings when the protection can be put there! Cafcass also need in-depth training on domestic abuse.

attributes.action: Prohibit Domestic CCTV/motion/auto tracking cameras  protruding over boundaries
attributes.background: There is no strict law only guidelines relating to CCTV for domestic use to stop a persons CCTV from overlooking other people's property.  This law needs to be made firm in that no domestic CCTV should overlook and protrude into another person's property
attributes.additional_details: The guidelines are that CCTV should not overlook another persons property.  It can however go over the boundary of the property where it is installed.  The use of motion tracking/auto tracking cameras tobe restricted to use inside a domestic property and not positioned where they can track movement from anywhere outside the property they are installed.  The installation of such cameras over another persons property goes against the grain of the Human Rights Act and the Data Protection Act

attributes.action: Prevent ratification of intl trade deals that allow the UK to be sued under ISDS
attributes.background: ISDS clauses allow investors to sue the government for any measures that harm their profits. Stop the ratification of trade deals that include ISDS clauses.
attributes.additional_details:
We are in a critically defining period of the UKs future. One that will be led by Trade Deals being written, negotiated and agreed right now, if Brexit goes ahead.

In this process Liam Fox MP has allowed ISDS clauses to be included in future International Trade Agreements. These will allow investors to sue the UK government for any measures that harm their profits. The future ramifications of this are incalculably bad for the prosperity of the UK.

This petition seeks to stop the UK Government ratifying trade deals that include ISDS clauses that would allow the UK to be sued.

attributes.action: Forbid payment of any money to the EU if the UK has no properly elected MEPs.
attributes.background: Whilst the UK is an EU member, permanently or in transition, she must not be allowed to make any financial payments to the EU unless the UK is represented by properly elected, not appointed, MEPs in the EU parliament. Primary legislation must be passed to prevent "taxation without representation"
attributes.additional_details:
The European Union has made plans to reallocate British MEP seats to other existing member states after 29th March 2019 and has failed to confirm UK elected MEPs will fill those seats if the EU and the UK government extend Britain's EU membership after that date.

It can not be allowed that British tax payers' money passes to an organisation for which the UK people have no parliamentary representation.

attributes.action: Allow the House of Commons as a whole to debate increased probate fees
attributes.background: By designating such rises as a fee, the Government has avoided proper parliamentary scrutiny, ensuring the increase is only debated in a Committee.
attributes.additional_details:
The requirement for Parliamentary Debate would stop this loophole being used as a precedent for future "stealth" increases of taxation and/or other "charges".

I believe that the use of this method on Probate Charges is a red herring on the basis that most people will see high Probate charges as only hitting the rich. The danger is that, if unchallenged, it may be used by Governments to raise other charges/taxes which could hit everyone. 
https://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-6680473/Fury-sneaky-6-000-death-tax-set-hit-300-000-families.html

attributes.action: Make the NHS prescribe drugs based on the patient’s medical need not the cost.
attributes.background: NHS and NICE guidelines for prescribing drugs should lead to the highest quality of patient care. Patients deserve access to drugs that can help to either save, extend or improve their lives no matter what the cost. The cost of drugs can be quantified, but how does one quantify the cost of a life?
attributes.additional_details: The decision-making process around the cost-effectiveness of prescription drugs is very obscure. The Government must make clearly understandable information available to explain how cost-effectiveness is calculated and how quality-adjusted life years work and consult the public on how they quantify the cost of a life. These calculations must be reviewed, as patients are dying because they can’t access the medication they need.

attributes.action: Fund housing support for people who live with a mentally ill family member.
attributes.background: It can be very difficult to live with a mentally ill relative. It can make it very hard to live normally, work, undertake education, etc. It can be impossible to get sleep, which can make it hard when someone has a job interview or needs to see their child.
attributes.additional_details: In a nutshell, the Government should fund some housing support to provide some respite, even if it's providing full or partial payment for a flatshare.

attributes.action: Acid attacks in the UK are at a rise, the Government should deter these attacks.
attributes.background: Acid attacks are at a rise within the United Kingdom, not enough is being done to deter these threats and violent crimes, therefore we are suggesting for the Government and Policing Services to validate the following: tougher prison sentences, tougher laws for purchase, increased education/research.
attributes.additional_details:
We believe the Government should implement:

- Tougher laws and Prison Sentences with a minimum of 18 years and maximum of 60
- ID will be needed to purchase chemicals
- Tax will be added to chemical purchases
- Chemicals over 30% will need a 'special ID' which is not handed to 
convicted individual(s)
- Education and research is increased
- Purchases should only be allowed to be made digitally by Credit Card for Police print
- Information of chemical purchases should be handled to the Police

attributes.action: Begin a root and branch review to overhaul the UK's current political system
attributes.background:
We are proud that the UK is the 'mother' of parliaments but as has been shown during the Brexit process. She is no longer effective or efficient in serving its people.

We ask for an independent, root and branch review of the current political system here in the UK to make it better.

attributes.action: Change the UK voting system to a system of Single-Transferable Vote
attributes.background: The UK voting system favours the mentality of 'tactical voting'. People vote for a party they do not very much agree with in order to keep a party they heavily disagree with from reaching a majority in Parliament. This leads to a stale two-party political system which leaves many disenfranchised.
attributes.additional_details:
Since 1945, the only two Political Parties to reach a majority in Parliament are Labour and the Conservatives. 

In the 2015 election, UKIP received a total of 3,881,099 votes and achieved 1 MP; the Liberal Democrats achieved 2,415,916 votes but won 8 MP's. Nearly 4 million people were left without a significant voice in parliament. 

Australia currently operates under Single-Transferable vote and this has allowed many smaller parties to gain traction in their Government.

attributes.action: Stop people buying animals for Christmas then getting rid of them,
attributes.background: Anyone getting an animal should be made to have a licence, as well as the animal being chipped, 1,000 pound fine for anyone who decides to just dump there animal, or imprisonment. Also a 5,000 pound license for animal breaders and only 2 litters aloud. All puppy kittens to be chipped.

attributes.action: Refurbish immigration and trade ports for WTO brexit
attributes.background: The Government needs to invest in refurbishing immigration and trade facilities at ports for a WTO Brexit.

attributes.action: Reintroduce a reformed national service. (Not just the military)
attributes.background: I feel that service in all areas of the nation will aid not only the country but the people serving it. It will teach life skills and discipline, something that is lacking in today’s society. It will also help to reduce selfishness in future generations.
attributes.additional_details:
2 years in one of the armed forces or emergency services. (This gives time to finish higher education and apprenticeships)
 
For those not eligible to join the services or choosing not to: 2 years as an apprentice tradesman or care worker.

attributes.action: Fund free transport for 16-22 year olds.
attributes.background: Transport for students is very expensive and in rural areas, it is too expensive to get to college or school. This potentially stops people from doing jobs that they want to do because they can't get there.

attributes.action: Give women 2 paid days off a month when needed during their time of the month.
attributes.background: Menstruation is bleeding that occurs when the uterus sheds its lining. Periods usually last from 2-7 days and can be light/heavy. Along with that women experience other symptoms such as back, neck and headaches, nausea, and diarrhea. Most women have to endure this whilst working and it's not right.
attributes.additional_details: Additionally more symptoms are migraines, stomachaches, and vomiting. Up to 20% of women experience extreme cramps at the onset of a period – a condition called dysmenorrhea. These cramps cause immense discomfort and pain, experiencing this at work affects productivity. Many women don't take sick days as it's something they know will come and simply cannot avoid unlike viral or bacterial illnesses almost all people experience. Other countries have adopted this and the UK should rightly follow suit.

attributes.action: Amend BBC Charter to cap executive salaries at no more than the Prime Minister's
attributes.background: This is a public body and employees should not earn more than the Prime Minister
attributes.additional_details:
The general public are fed up with huge salaries , mainly being earned by those in the south of the country. 
As the BBC is funded by the public, salaries for executives should be capped.

attributes.action: Counselling and support should be provided for those who commit crimes early on.
attributes.background: This is for our citizenship GCSE campaign and we strongly believe that if changes were made, then crimes within the youth would be significantly reduced.
attributes.additional_details:
In the year 2017,  4,315,500 crimes were recorded. 
74,784 were the arrests of young children and the youth. 
On average a custodial sentenced youth sentence length would be around 16 months long.
13,500 youth cautions were given to young people throughout the UK.
We believe that if we can read signs and tackle them with suitable guidance then we will be able to reduce these numbers and hopefully provide a better future for the next generation.
With proper support, counselling and guidance from the government real changes can be made. Help create sustainable futures for OUR youth.

attributes.action: Allow teaching of Quran to Muslim kids as part of required RE in primary schools
attributes.background: All Muslim kids going to Mosque after school for Quran reading. They are too tired every day after studying at two institutes school and Mosque.
attributes.additional_details: We have to make both possible at one place in the best interest of kids. The law should change so Muslim children can learn the Quran at primary schools.

attributes.action: Make it compulsary to put food miles on packaging
attributes.background: When I was shopping I saw that English potatoes cost 10p more than egyptian ones. It then occurred to me the distance they had travelled (probably by air) and thought for 10p I can reduce the pollution created by importing goods. If food miles on packaging we can all make informed decisions.

attributes.action: Amend Universal Credit regulations so it can cover 53 week periods
attributes.background: Universal Credit (UC) is paid monthly to Landlords. If rent is paid weekly, the monthly rate is worked out by multiplying the weekly rent by 52, then dividing by 12.
attributes.additional_details:
However, every 5-7 years some landlords charge for 53 weeks! So UC Claimants lose out 1 whole week of rent! This is unfair to Claimants and Landlords!
 
I quote from UC website: "Universal Credit will always be calculated based on a 52 week year, unless rent is charged over fewer than 52 weeks".
 
https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/universal-credit-and-rented-housing--2/universal-credit-and-rented-housing-guide-for-landlords
 
This issue has been raised a few times directly with Universal Credit, but they are adamant they will only pay for 52 weeks! This needs to be raised for a discussion by the Parliament. Help me reach 100,000 signs!

attributes.action: Make MPs vote by secret ballot in Parliament
attributes.background: When we hold a General Election, a Local Election, a Referendum or when a union holds a strike ballot, voting is done by secret ballot, to remove intimidation. We should insist on nothing less for our MPs, to allow them to vote with their consciences and best judgement, and to prevent intimidation.
attributes.additional_details:
The Brexit debates in Parliament have shown, time and again, that party leaders can, and do, influence the way their MPs vote.
 
If all Parliamentary votes were by secret it would empower Parliament to actually be our Supreme lawmaking body, and prevent Governments from sidelining it
